meanings.definition: To be under obligation to pay or repay (money)
meanings.sent1: I am owing my friend ten dollars for the movie tickets.
meanings.sent2: She is owing the bank a large sum of money for her car loan.
meanings.sent3: The cat is owing the dog a treat for chasing away the birds.
meanings.sent4: The success of the project is owing to the hard work of the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful garden is owing its lushness to the dedicated gardener.

meanings.definition: To be due or owed (a debt)
meanings.sent1: The rent is owing at the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: The company is owing its suppliers a significant amount for the materials.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel is owing the birds some seeds for stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The peaceful atmosphere in the room is owing to the calming music playing.
meanings.sent5: The success of the event is owing to the meticulous planning by the organizers.

meanings.definition: To be attributable or ascribable to (a particular cause)
meanings.sent1: The increase in sales is owing to the new marketing strategy.
meanings.sent2: The delay in the project is owing to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful behavior is owing to its energetic nature.
meanings.sent4: The success of the play is owing to the talented actors.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset is owing to the clear skies and calm weather.
